Content: We were here in March 2017 and the beach was quite clean. We were lucky to be staying at Alila with an Ocean view room so it was great waking up to see locals and tourist having morning walks and having fun. From Alila, we walked along the beach front to Kuta which didn't take long (prob shorter than a taxi ride!) and we also walked in the opposite direction towards Canggu. On our walks we discovered a few local bars (no hype type...) on beach front, so take some Rp with you for a quick stop and support the locals.
review: march 2017 quite clean lucky stay alila ocean view room great wake see local tourist morning walk fun alila walk along front kuta didnt take long prob shorter taxi ride walk opposite direction towards canggu walk discover local bar hype type front take rp quick stop support local

Content: Beach is rather dirty but since we have come back it has improved a fair bit and they are doing dinners and drinks along the beach, more festive to go at night
review: rather dirty come back improve fair bit dinner drink along festive go night

Content: Presently at Alila --Seminyak. The beach is fabulous here, you just step down a few steps and you're there.from Courtyard it's about 300 m to the beach, too overcrowded I feel.
review: presently alila seminyak fabulous step step youre therefrom courtyard 300 m overcrowd feel

Content: Unfortunately with current beach covered in pollution, they did have signs up apologizing for it, effort was been made to clean it up! Water was warm rough, great for surfing, unfortunately no swimming was permitted during the week 1 was there signs everywhere!
review: unfortunately current cover pollution sign apologize effort make clean water warm rough great surf unfortunately swim permit week 1 sign everywhere

Content: Coming from South Africa with our beautiful white sand beaches it has been quite a shock to see so much litter in the ocean. It makes me feel really sad. We are lucky enough to be doing a home exchange and staying at the 5 star Anantura Hotel right on the beach so we just swim in the pool here. It's a great wave for beginners to learn to surf though and my boyfriend had such fun while I taught him on a long board we rented for R50 an hour right in front of our hotel on the beach. Haggle the price of board rentals with the locals so they don't rip you off!
review: come south africa beautiful white sand beach quite shock see much litter ocean make feel really sad lucky enough home exchange stay 5 star anantura hotel right swim pool great wave beginner learn surf though boyfriend fun teach long board rent r50 hour right front hotel haggle price board rentals local dont rip

Content: The beach was safe and hassle free. neat small waves to body surf. Nobody was in the water until the three of us went in and about 10 followed. They all appeared to be having a great time body surfing.
review: safe hassle free neat small wave body surf nobody water three u go 10 follow appear great time body surf

Content: Did not like Seminyak beach the sand was black & in certain areas it was smelly due to some outlets running from the streets through to the beach.
review: seminyak sand black certain area smelly due outlet run street

Content: Nice beach if you want to chill and have drinks with friends!It gets pretty crowded, since most beaches around have reefs and stones, and this is a sand beach, but it's still niceGood sunset view Unfortunately, many garbage left at the beach, like most places in Bali
review: nice want chill drink friendsit get pretty crowded beach around reefs stone sand still nicegood sunset view unfortunately many garbage leave place bali

Content: Beautiful relaxing place to visit. Food, drinks, entertainment right there, no need to wander any further!
review: beautiful relax place visit food drink entertainment right need wander

Content: A visit to Seminyak beach is not relaxing. There is rubbish everywhere, dogs running about and doing the toilet in the ocean. You are harassed constantly from not only the deck chair men but also kids trying to sell bracelets, and other people selling watches and sunglasses. You get touched often by women trying to offer manicures and pedicures and massages!! To top it all off, we watched a women remove her baby's dirty nappy, wash the kid in the sea and then bury the nappy in the sand, 50m in front of us!!!!Not exactly tranquil or picturesque!
review: visit seminyak relax rubbish everywhere dog run toilet ocean harass constantly deck chair men kid try sell bracelet people sell watch sunglass touch often woman try offer manicure pedicure massage top watch woman remove baby dirty nappy wash kid sea bury nappy sand 50m front usnot exactly tranquil picturesque

Content: Great atmosphere, dirty beach. Be prepared for people wanting to sell you anything and everything. Live music and drinks were great.
review: great atmosphere dirty prepared people want sell anything everything live music drink great

Content: This beach was closest to our hotel - within walking distance but it is poorly maintained.  Outside showers were turned off, so there was no way to rinse the sand off.  No other facilities available.
review: close hotel within walk distance poorly maintain outside shower turn way rinse sand facility available

Content: Not sure what I can say about a beach butt he only reason it doesn't get 5/5 is because it can get a bit busy and can be a bit annoying with people always trying to sell you stuff.
review: sure say butt reason doesnt 55 bit busy bit annoy people always try sell stuff

Content: The beach was filthy and covered in rubbish. Stray dogs all over the place and lots of dog poop. The weather wasn't particularly good either but the overall cleanliness left a lot to be desired.
review: filthy cover rubbish stray dog place lot dog poop weather wasnt particularly good either overall cleanliness leave lot desire

Content: This is one of the most disgustingly dirty beaches I have ever seen and I have travelled. The amount of rubbish washed up on the beach and not cleared away is a disgrace and an example of the crisis our oceans are suffering.  Why anyone would want to come and sit on it and look out at the rubbish is beyond me and why any Aussie would come from the beautiful beaches in Australia to surf here is crazy.  I went for an early morning run and had to wash my trainers after because I ran through the streams that led into the sea, the smell was so bad, god knows what is in that water and now in the sea.
review: one disgustingly dirty beach see travelled amount rubbish wash clear away disgrace example crisis oceans suffer anyone want come sit look rubbish beyond aussie come beautiful beach australia surf crazy go early morning run wash trainer run stream lead sea smell bad god know water now sea

Content: So far, it's clean n nice to chill n relax.. $10 for pair of seats plus free coconut drink.. Well, sit back n enjoy the view.. 👙😎
review: far clean n nice chill n relax 10 pair seat plus free coconut drink well sit back n enjoy view

Content: Beach is great waves good for surfing, lounges cost 200,000 Rp per day $20Drinks available from vendors just don't have the ice.
review: great wave good surfing lounge cost 200000 rp per day 20drinks available vendor dont ice

Content: Beautiful Beach, but it was kinda dirty. A lot of Plastic rubbish on the beach. Maybe it was very very bad Weather for 4 days. But I hope they will clean it. On Sunday was very crowded, many local people as well, they played football on the beach. Otherwise we love the beach.
review: beautiful kinda dirty lot plastic rubbish maybe bad weather 4 day hope will clean sunday crowd many local people well play football love

Content: Good to hang out from morning to dusk. Sip in some really good beverages or try out some awesome dishes while relaxing at the beach from the numerous restaurants present there !
review: good hang morning dusk sip really good beverage try awesome dish relax numerous restaurant present

Content: I've been in Bali in july 2016 and i think i'll return there next year! Amazing island, amazing people, gorgeous food😍
review: ive bali july 2016 think ill return next year amaze island amaze people gorgeous food

Content: Whenever we go out for a meal we try to make it back to our hotel via the beach.As others have mentioned, there is a fair bit of rubbish that washes up which is a shame, so you need to be careful of where you tread at times.Seminyak Beach has vast expanses of sand and is very flat so a great beach for walking.We sat outside Ku De Ta so we could hear the music and relax while the sun went down.Others were sitting on a picnic blanket with a bottle of wine doing the same.Sunset draws a huge crowd but there is plenty of room for everyone.
review: whenever go meal try make back hotel via beachas others mention fair bit rubbish wash shame need careful tread timesseminyak vast expanse sand flat great walkingwe sit outside ku de ta hear music relax sun go downothers sit picnic blanket bottle wine samesunset draw huge crowd plenty room everyone

Content: Prices are a little more expensive for beach chairs but you pay for cleanliness and less of a crowd. Surf is great if 5ft swell or better from low to mid tide with long running lefts and rights. Great for sunset surf with kudeta playing chill out house music in the background.
review: price little expensive chair pay cleanliness less crowd surf great 5ft swell well low mid tide long run lefts right great sunset surf kudeta play chill house music background

Content: We found this beach to be one of the nicest during our time in Bali.Its not as hectic as the others but yet still boasting lots of local character, the bars are rather more upmarket but yet you can still find the odd local hideaway thats well worth the find so its a lovely blend of local to luxurious.The good thing we loved was that your not as bothered by all the beach sellers as you are on other beaches and also the sellers here are a lot more chilled.
review: find one nice time baliits hectic others yet still boast lot local character bar rather upmarket yet still find odd local hideaway thats well worth find lovely blend local luxuriousthe good thing love bothered seller beach seller lot chill

Content: We loved this beach and it holds many fond memories for us. I especially loved it early in the morning when the stall holders and cafes were setting up.  The various fishermen with their long casting rods were a curious sight amongst the surfers, yet this amazing beach could accommodate us all!
review: love hold many fond memory u especially love early morning stall holder cafes set various fisherman long cast rod curious sight amongst surfer yet amaze accommodate u

Content: Beach was nice, but had a bunch of signs up for No swimming.  Only for surfers or sun bathing.  Sun is very strong, apply plenty lotion.

Content: We have been to most of the beaches around here and this is our favourite. It is probably the cleanest and has lots to do to keep you occupied through the day.Many places rent sun bed and umbrellas quite cheaply and some restaurants even allow you to use their bean bags for free as long as you give them your custom. There are lots of bars and restaurants in the area and also lots of beach traders. The sand  itself is generally of good quality and you can use the beach to either relax or undertake more strenuous activities. There is lots of surfing and we used to do long beach walks.
review: beach around favourite probably clean lot keep occupied daymany place rent sun bed umbrellas quite cheaply restaurant even allow use bean bag free long give custom lot bar restaurant area lot trader sand generally good quality use either relax undertake strenuous activity lot surf use long walk

Restaurants all the way along with very friendly staff and great service. Bands played the whole time we were there. Definitely a must to do at night while on Seminyak

They attempt to keep it clean and in the mornings it is mostly okay, but when the tide comes in so does all of the trash. It becomes like a dump site. I don't know how anyone walks on this beach barefoot, especially in the evenings. It is really disappointing and a bit alarming.

Content: The hype is totally justified! Try anything and it will be amazing. I LOVED the pancakes! Staff is awesome!

Enjoying the sunset while relaxing in one of the beach side clubs and restaurants, or strolling on the beach while admiring how the sky slowly transformed from blue to orange to black here is truly a great experience.

Content: Enjoyed a slow barefooted walk from Seminyak beach all the way to Kuta. Took about 1.5hours in the evening. The sun was a little scotching but the view was magnificent. The beach was quiet (at Seminyak end) and picturesque. Went we were at Kuta beach, the sun was setting and it was perfect to take in a moment to marvel at the wonders of nature and how fortunate were we to enjoy a holiday.We got a little sunburned after the walk though.. so 10/10 would recommend sunblock. :p

Content: Great clean beach but very load music everywhere as well as beach vendors trying to sell their stuff and trying and trying again,the same came around at least 3 times...but still great big beach and lively sunset.would not spend one week here but for a couple of days,great beach ambiance!
review: great clean load music everywhere well vendor try sell stuff try try againthe come around least 3 timesbut still great big lively sunsetwould spend one week couple daysgreat ambiance

Content: Seminyak beach is beautiful, stretching for kilometers. Great for walking, surfing (body, bogey board and just surfboard), and taking amazing photographs of Bali Beach Life and, of course, beautiful sunsets. It is also lined with some amazing places to eat and sleep (see my other reviews for Seminyak) which are perfect for a drink, a meal or just  enjoying the almost nightly beautiful sunsets. This would be a five star beach except for two, or three caveats. One is that alot of people have dogs in Bali and bring them on the beach. Which means if you like to walk barefoot on the beach, like I do, then you need to pay extra attention that you don't step into a fresh dog droppings. Two is that at various points along the beach there are effluents from various parts of town. This is raw sewage. I either walk out in the surf to cross them or just turn around and walk the other way. Needless to say, you don't want to be swimming directly offshore, or down current unless you've had all your shots!;) Thirdly is a new hazard which I only noticed on this last trip, which is broken shards of glass from beer bottles. The ones I spotted at low tide were in the shallow water and constantly being covered and uncovered by the trailing surf. I made a mental note to myself to pack my white water sandals next time I come. It's really a shame that such a beautiful natural spot as Seminyak is being polluted in this way. But while the above hazards do detract from the water and beach activities they do not affect the absolutely amazing sunsets.
review: seminyak beautiful stretch kilometer great walk surf body bogey board surfboard take amazing photograph bali life course beautiful sunset line amazing place eat sleep see reviews seminyak perfect drink meal enjoy almost nightly beautiful sunset five star except two three caveat one alot people dog bali bring mean walk barefoot need pay extra attention dont step fresh dog droppings two various point along effluent various part town raw sewage either walk surf cross turn around walk way needless say dont want swim directly offshore current unless youve shot thirdly new hazard notice last trip break shard glass beer bottle one spot low tide shallow water constantly cover uncovered trailing surf make mental note pack white water sandal next time come really shame beautiful natural spot seminyak pollute way hazard detract water activity affect absolutely amazing sunset

We enjoyed snapping pictures, walking around and then grabbing a drink and listening to live music as we watched it set. It might not be the best beach for swimming but the nightlife looked great and it was relatively clean (compared to other areas). Definitely not secluded - tons of tourists.

It's still bussing with people and activity however and has a great atmosphere but swimmers were noticeably absent. They do keep sweeping it up but they really need to address the source of the problem for the sake of tourism as well as nature.

Content: Slightly better the monstrosity which is Kuta beach. Cleaner, but it is still nothing special. We found a small spot to sunbathe in but that's about it. The water was brown and the waves were strong, wouldn't recommend for kids

Content: Went for a walk along the beach at Seminyak for about 45 minutes and we were saddened to see the amount of rubbish washed up on the shoreline. Considering the beaches on Bali are the main attraction, I believe that a lot more should be done to clean them up and keep them clean. There were literally thousands of plastic bags, drinking straws, cigarette lighters and innumerable other items that just should not belong on a beach.One can only be saddened to think of what this rubbish, particularly the plastic bags, is doing to the sea life.Please Bali - Clean up your act!
review: go walk along seminyak 45 minute sadden see amount rubbish wash shoreline consider beach bali main attraction believe lot do clean keep clean literally thousand plastic bag drink straws cigarette lighter innumerable item belong beachone sadden think rubbish particularly plastic bag sea lifeplease bali clean act

Content: Waiters don't give your change expect it as a tip. Often price of bill different from original order from menu. Food not as ordered and undercooked

Content: Wide expanse of endless beach, shared by many hotels dotting the whole strip of beach. The waves are excellent for surfers but perhaps it was this time of the year, that the sea seems to churn up the muddy sandbed and cause the pristine blue water to turn brownish as the waves washes ashore, exposing the filth and plastics along the beach. It is otherwise lovely, and a great place for enjoying the sun and the natural sea breeze. When the sun sets, the afterglow of the setting sun is reflected off the freshly rolled back beach, the contrast and shilouette views makes for perfect sunset photography and sights.

Content: Garbage in the water, garbage on the beach and sewage in the streams heading to the ocean. Seminyak is a cool place to visit but if the beach is your focus go elsewhere.

Content: Beaches was filled with trash. Very disappointed. Beach had solicitors. No public bathrooms. Not worth going to don't waste your time and money.
review: beach fill trash disappointed solicitor public bathroom worth go dont waste time money

Content: Never saw the beach from Kuta all the way to Seminyak beach and beyond in such a sad state. I loved to walk there for hours but what we saw there yesterday was a disaster:- plastic garbage strewn over the beach everywhere, not 10 meters without stepping on some garbage- those village canals bringing raw sewage to the beach offloading their smelly load into the waters.- brown foam and waves every few hundred meters when another canals lands on the beach- a permanent sewage smell in the air although it was a windy day- beach erosion is a big problem; the beach hotels are fortifying their beach line with cement. The stairs from their gardens to the beach has become one meter longer (Legian Hotel) since I have seen it 3 years ago.We were disgusted and did not go into the waters there. Our little son got a skin rash on legs and back from that sewage water.The government needs to act:- clean the canals- introduce effective waste management- stop corruptionThe hotels and tourist industry should step up to the government and demand environmental improvement!!!Good luck
review: never saw kuta way seminyak beyond sad state love walk hour saw yesterday disaster plastic garbage strewn everywhere 10 meter without step garbage village canal bring raw sewage offload smelly load water brown foam wave every hundred meter another canal land permanent sewage smell air although windy day erosion big problem hotel fortify line cement stair garden become one meter long legian hotel see 3 year agowe disgust go water little son get skin rash leg back sewage waterthe government need act clean canal introduce effective waste management stop corruptionthe hotel tourist industry step government demand environmental improvementgood luck

Content: Absolutely  filthy with litterMouldy looking beanbags and piles of rubbish everywhere.Walked along to get a sense of the place but never even bothered going back
review: absolutely filthy littermouldy look beanbag pile rubbish everywherewalked along sense place never even bother go back

Content: We arrived into Seminyak late on a Thursday and couldn't wait to see the beach on Wednesday morning. Given the time zone change we were up early so wondered down to the beach for a walk. We go there within 5 minutes but what we found was disappointing. It was low tide and all manner of garbage was washed up and the ocean was brown. There were mane workers sweeping/raking up the mess given the many hotels that line the beach. Over the next week things didn't really improve although it was beautiful to listen to the waves at night. Seminyak is a wonderful place but the beach isn't the highlight. We didn't get to see any outstanding sunsets given cloud cover but what we did see was impressive and we had a wonderful anniversary at La lucciola. Also beware of time share workers posing as tourist officers asking your opinion, they get your hotel, your name and length of stay and then bombard you with phone calls. Not pleasant but our villa did a wonderful job at filtering these.
review: arrive seminyak late thursday couldnt wait see wednesday morning give time zone change early wonder walk go within 5 minute find disappointing low tide manner garbage wash ocean brown mane worker sweepingraking mess give many hotel line next week thing didnt really improve although beautiful listen wave night seminyak wonderful place isnt highlight didnt see outstanding sunset give cloud cover see impressive wonderful anniversary la lucciola beware time share worker pose tourist officer ask opinion hotel name length stay bombard phone call pleasant villa wonderful job filter

Content: Seminyak beach must be one of the worst beaches we've been on. It's filthy with rubbish everywhere. We walked all the way from chez gado gado restaurant to Potato head club and the whole stretch was dirty. Also, as you'd expect, it has heaps of locals trying to sell you things and although we understand they are trying to make a living, saying "no, thank you" every couple of minutes gets somehow tiring after a while...the dark volcanic sand doesn't help the situation and makes the beach look even dirtier. Water looks muddy and just like the beach is full of rubbish.

Content: Seminyak is an upbeat part of Bali with a little something for everyone. Whether you're looking for relaxation and spirituality, or just a really fun bar run, Seminyak has something for you. Love the locals, some of the nicest people I've met. Also, Seminyak offered greater variety of cuisine and dining options than Kuta.You can have Indonesian streetfood or a five star Continental meal.
review: seminyak upbeat part bali little something everyone whether youre look relaxation spirituality really fun bar run seminyak something love local nice people ive meet seminyak offer great variety cuisine din option kutayou indonesian streetfood five star continental meal

Content: We stayed at the Anatara Resort on the beach and took a stroll across the beach and it was splendid. We managed to walk for over a couple of miles without any hesitation or break. The beech is cleaner and nicer than the one at Kuta and lesser people come here. There are plenty of inexpensive places to dine on the beach and have a couple of beers. Worth spending time here than KUTA .
review: stay anatara resort take stroll across splendid manage walk couple mile without hesitation break beech clean nicer one kuta less people come plenty inexpensive place dine couple beer worth spending time kuta

This makes the walk from Pura Petitenget to Double six beach (same for the reverse direction)     a little bit unpleasant.

Content: By the time I got to Seminyak beach in the morning the day was already hot.  Waves were moderate, and the water looked brown with churned up sand. In retrospect I would probably have gone there later in the day to watch the sunset, but had a very pleasant time on the sand nevertheless.  I plan to return.

Content: To the Balanese government.I understand that the natural tides dump rubbish on the beaches, but there is no visible effort to clear it up! If every hawker was equipped with a litterpicker and a bin bag as part of the deal you'd sort the problem to a more reasonable degree. Billions of tourist dollars over the years should result in something more than an appologising and apologetic sign!Having travelled half way around the world to such a legendary and beautiful place the sea and the beaches are a HUGE disappointment and do you no credit Bali!You let down yourselves and, more importantly, the Balinese people!

Content: I've been around the world and been to many beaches in many countries both poor and rich.  This is by far the most disgusting, upsetting and disturbing thing I have ever seen.  The beach is literally covered in garbage.  Swimming in the ocean there is garbage floating everywhere.  You should not come out of the ocean with a plastic bag wrapped around your foot, cigarette packages, yogurt containers, you name it.  Apparently it's all coming from Java the main island, but I've been told it's been happening for a long time.  Honestly it is very upsetting.  Don't come here unless you're happy to stay in your hotel at the pool  If you're a beach person avoid at all costs.  Go literally anywhere else.

Content: I arrived on 27/12 and this was my first trip to Bali. The beach was filled with rubbish, which I learnt soon enough happens every year in Seminyak. The sand was the colour of dirt - not very enticing to lay a towel on! It was a shame that the hotel I stayed in employed guys to "clean up" the rubbish, but this literaly involved pushing the stuff further up the beach, either out of view of the hotel guests, or just far enough so that when the tide came in, it took the rubbish back out into the sea! Really disappointing that this hasn't been dealt with considering it happens every year.
review: arrived 2712 first trip bali fill rubbish learnt soon enough happen every year seminyak sand colour dirt entice lay towel shame hotel stay employ guy clean rubbish literaly involve push stuff either view hotel guest far enough tide come take rubbish back sea really disappointing hasnt deal consider happens every year

Content: I was in Seminyak in the winter 2014 and was already shocked then by the incredibly dirty beach and ocean. The sewage is running straight into the sea on various points along the beach. This has not changed at all from my first visit. The long ring road Jl.Drupadi at the time as in a horrible condition with sewage canals left and right from the street with the appropriate smell and moscitos, rats etc.This road was now completely redone with small but nice sidewalks now covering the mentioned canals. However, the sidewalks are usually parked with lots of motorbikes so that one still has to go down on the street all the time.And still by walking the streets, there is nothing changed with trash piles all over the place. At each street corner you see them and nobody seems to bother. In contrary, when you tell the locals about it, they blame the tourists but my observations where that it is actually themselves throwing plastic bags, food containers, bottles and all other kinds of trash whereever they stand and walk.The same goes for the beach...dont tell the locals as they will explain you that the trash comes because of the storm and wind and coming from the neighboring islands. And even if the trash comes from another planet: CLEAN IT UP !!!! Tourists have choices.. For the long flying time from Europe, you would expect paradise but coming into horror. We had a similar island in the mediteranean called Mallorca which was developped for tourism very early, similar to Bali, with the same negative aspects. But they have learned it the hard way and changed their approach to tourism almost 20 years ago by imposing taxes on tourists, cleaning up the entire island, building trash incineration plants, building water desalination plants, since they also had a major water problem, building proper roads and a great pubic transport system.This island is now an example how it can move from a current Bali standard into something called a true vacation paradise..but of course it does not come cheap and it will turn away certain types of tourists and will take time. I wish that Bali takes this step too otherwise it will be a lost paradise !
review: seminyak winter 2014 already shock incredibly dirty ocean sewage run straight sea various point along change first visit long ring road jldrupadi time horrible condition sewage canal leave right street appropriate smell moscitos rat etcthis road now completely redo small nice sidewalk now cover mention canal sidewalk usually park lot motorbike one still go street timeand still walk street nothing change trash pile place street corner see nobody seem bother contrary tell local blame tourist observation actually throw plastic bag food container bottle kind trash whereever stand walkthe go beachdont tell local will explain trash come storm wind come neighboring island even trash come another planet clean tourist choice long fly time europe expect paradise come horror similar island mediteranean call mallorca developped tourism early similar bali negative aspect learn hard way change approach tourism almost 20 year ago impose tax tourist clean entire island building trash incineration plant build water desalination plant major water problem building proper roads great pubic transport systemthis island now example move current bali standard something call true vacation paradisebut course come cheap will turn away certain type tourist will take time wish bali take step will lose paradise

Content: Appalling place. Our second visit & we hoped it was cleaned up, but it's worse. Kilometres of beach covered in plastic bottles & rubbish. We went in the water - full of sewerage & other rubbish, it'd be dangerous to your health to swim in it. The locals don't seem to care & they blame the tourist boats but don't even clean it. What should be a beautiful place is far from it.It's a sad example of rampant development & apathy. We'll never go to Bali again. It's ruined.
review: appal place second visit hop cleaned bad kilometre cover plastic bottle rubbish go water full sewerage rubbish itd dangerous health swim local dont seem care blame tourist boat dont even clean beautiful place far itits sad example rampant development apathy well never go bali ruin

Content: Great for listening to music and drinking by the beach sitting on bean bags...not really good for young family though.
review: great listening music drink sit bean bagsnot really good young family though

Content: We chose Seminyak for our honeymoon stay as it supposed to be one of the best beaches on Bali, but were very much disappointed to say the least. We met only pollution with plastic, huge mountains of rubbish on and next to the beach about which locals say it comes from China. Also it is very crowded and very loud. In June 2016 most of the time swimming was prohibited due to huge waves and every 100m stinky sewage water was led into the ocean. It is a tragedy that the awareness about the unbelievable environmental damage is that little...
review: chose seminyak honeymoon stay suppose one best beach bali much disappointed say least met pollution plastic huge mountain rubbish next local say come china crowd loud june 2016 time swim prohibit due huge wave every 100m stinky sewage water lead ocean tragedy awareness unbelievable environmental damage little

Content: It's an ok beach but Kuta and Legian are much better. There is a big undertow which puts so much sand in the water. There were some good sets of waves so the surfers might like it. There is a good little bar 707 in the batubelig area that is worth a beer after a swim or surf
review: ok kuta legian much good big undertow put much sand water good set wave surfer might good little bar 707 batubelig area worth beer swim surf

Content: Great for dinner on the beach you can eat relax and listen to live music . Sunset was pretty. Don't swim here the beach is dirty !!
review: great dinner eat relax listen live music sunset pretty dont swim dirty

Content: Beach loungers are beanbags. they leak. Millions of pellets everywhere, and beach bands set too close together so you hear two bands at once. This isn't celebrating sunset...it's celebrating idiocy.
review: lounger beanbags leak million pellet everywhere band set close together hear two band isnt celebrate sunsetits celebrate idiocy

Content: When we planned our trip that beachs in bali would be like the once in Thailand, nice, blue, calm. However when we arrived here we realized that its not the same. If you are someone, who enjoys the beach.and don't use that term loosely, I do mean the beach and not a beach side resort, then think again, the waves are very loud and the shore is choppy. You can't even sit on the beach cause sand gets so hot that you'll burn your self. Very disappointed.
review: plan trip beach bali thailand nice blue calm arrive realize someone enjoy beachand dont use term loosely mean side resort think wave loud shore choppy cant even sit cause sand get hot youll burn self disappoint

Content: Nice clean and happening beach. specially during sunsets it become pretty happening with beach goers, music, drinks. nice fun overall.
review: nice clean happen specially sunsets become pretty happen goer music drink nice fun overall

Content: If you want a feel for night club life and people hustling you then this is your place. The beach was so littered we were walking through an area where the water was brown and frothy. Rivers from the town empty into this beach area and you have to walk through the filth even if you are just trying to walk along the beach. It's sad how much garbage we saw. No one seemed to care either.
review: want feel night club life people hustle place litter walk area water brown frothy river town empty area walk filth even try walk along sad much garbage saw one seem care either

Content: Antons bar and Andre ,what a great bunch of young trustworthy gentlemen, you can leave all your belongings with them safely and enjoy many beverages..there is a young man named Putra who works in bar next door Auzzie bar who is a must to see as well ,rips up the beach breaks on 66 with his phantom surf board .
review: antons bar andre great bunch young trustworthy gentleman leave belonging safely enjoy many beveragesthere young man name putra work bar next door auzzie bar must see well rip break 66 phantom surf board

Content: Rubbish in the water makes this side of Bali a very sorry sight. People from the sunset clubs on the beach leave there rubbish behind and then you find yourself swimming in the ocean with hundreds of plastic bottles and rubbish. Stick to your pool side resorts!!!
review: rubbish water make side bali sorry sight people sunset club leave rubbish behind find swim ocean hundred plastic bottle rubbish stick pool side resort

Content: Don't expect an idyllic, white sand beach....this isn't it. I know I am spoiled by the beaches in Australia but there is a huge problem with rubbish. There's piles of it everywhere and when I was surfing I was surfing with so much plastic and rubbish. However, the beach bars are nice - very cheap and you get to hang out with locals. The sunsets are spectacular and I highly recommend some beers on the beach at the bars at sunset.
review: dont expect idyllic white sand beachthis isnt know spoil beach australia huge problem rubbish there pile everywhere surf surf much plastic rubbish bar nice cheap hang local sunset spectacular highly recommend beer bar sunset

Content: We had a drink on the bean bags on the beach. The sand and water is very dirty. Nice sunset and interesting characters but didn't feel the need to visit again.
review: drink bean bag sand water dirty nice sunset interest character didnt feel need visit

Content: its quite long, beautiful at any time of the day but specially at sunset, its you and the beach, all other noises just disappear
review: quite long beautiful time day specially sunset noise disappear

Content: Loved Bali but WTF, the beach is absolutely and utterly disgusting. Swimming would definitely constitute a health hazard, that is if you don't get tangled up in some of the debris. Unless the Indonesian government takes radical action, nobody will go there.
review: love bali wtf absolutely utterly disgust swim definitely constitute health hazard dont tangle debris unless indonesian government take radical action nobody will go

Content: A good beach .. i spent most of my evenings here as during the day shore was littered and was very annoying to see it like that.During dusk, the restaurants come to life., you can easily spend long time eating, drinking bintang and gazing the sun. personally i preffered seminyak area and beach over Kuta..
review: good spent evening day shore litter annoy see thatduring dusk restaurant come life easily spend long time eat drink bintang gaze sun personally preffered seminyak area kuta

Content: When Seminyak Beach has been cleaned of storm or rainy season debris it is a great beach to relax and swim.If you require shade and in the Balinese heat it is advisable be prepared to pay 100 000IDR for a umbrella and lounge.
review: seminyak clean storm rainy season debris great relax swimif require shade balinese heat advisable prepared pay 100 000idr umbrella lounge

Content: During the day the beach is disgusting.Night time not so bad as you don't get to see the filth right along the entire beach. The water is like a cesspool,I certainly wouldn't swim in it.
review: day disgustingnight time bad dont see filth right along entire water cesspooli certainly wouldnt swim

Content: When we visited there was no rubbish like there was at beaches at Legian and Kuta. Also nobody bugging you to buy stuff which was a bonus.
review: visited rubbish beach legian kuta nobody bug buy stuff bonus

Content: Very dirty, a lot of garbage coming from the sea and Java island make this beach entirely unattractive place to visit.
review: dirty lot garbage come sea java island make entirely unattractive place visit

Content: Such a shame that fellow travellers don't put their rubbish in the beach , they have ruined this beach .
review: shame fellow traveller dont put rubbish ruin

Content: Xmas/wet season is not the time to stay in Seminyak. The beaches in this area are covered in rubbish that washes up every tide this time of year. We've been here for 3 weeks over Xmas/NY and haven't spent any time on the beaches, it's that bad. You'd be better off staying on the eastern side, Sanur area. Nice beaches, clear water.
review: xmaswet season time stay seminyak beach area cover rubbish wash every tide time year weve 3 week xmasny havent spent time beach bad youd well stay eastern side sanur area nice beach clear water

Content: Hello Future Bali Traveler !   trip of a lifetime.  The waves the people the sand and the surf. Amazing time.  don't miss this.
review: hello future bali traveler trip lifetime wave people sand surf amazing time dont miss

Content: We are pretty spoiled in Australia & New Zealand for the cleaniness of our beaches. Unfortunately, the beaches we went to in Seminyak were full of rubbish & a bit smelly in places. Really takes away from the experience. However, we did enjoy a nice sunset which was lovely, and the photos couldn't pick up the rubbish!
review: pretty spoil australia new zealand cleaniness beach unfortunately beach go seminyak full rubbish bit smelly place really take away experience enjoy nice sunset lovely photos couldnt pick rubbish

Content: Good beach with a number of nice hotels but not really suitable for swimming due to strong current and unpredictable waves...
review: good number nice hotel really suitable swimming due strong current unpredictable wave

Content: Going in November I thought it would be busy, but I was wrong.  It was really the best time to go - water was perfect and the beach not busy.  Highly recommend it!
review: go november think busy wrong really best time go water perfect busy highly recommend

Content: The seminyak beach is a local beach not a private one, lacks basic cleanliness.The water is very dirty filled with plastic bottles and caps and other junk.Please visit private beaches adjoining the resorts instead.The water temperature was warm for December.
review: seminyak local private one lack basic cleanlinessthe water dirty fill plastic bottle cap junkplease visit private beach adjoin resort insteadthe water temperature warm december

Content: By far the most polluted beach I have ever seen.  Definitely not good for swimming.  The shopping and restaurants are awesome but stay in your pool
review: far pollute see definitely good swimming shopping restaurants awesome stay pool

Content: Everything was overly priced and you constantly have to haggle with the sellers.  Food was over priced on the beach and it was VERY VERY dirty.  I didn't want to even take off my shoe in case I catch something.
review: everything overly price constantly haggle seller food price dirty didnt want even take shoe case catch something

Content: The beach is very disappointing... obviously polluted with tons of rubbish along the beach. Sunsets are the only saving grace!
review: disappoint obviously pollute ton rubbish along sunset save grace

Content: I have seen Seminyak Beach during the dry and its beautiful but unfortunately on our last trip during the wet season it was sad to see so much rubbish on the beach. Yes, great for sunsets but so is Sanur and Jimbaran without the rubbish. I wouldn't take kids here during the wet season too much rubbish. Something needs to be done to improve this as many traders are loosing business as people don't want to be there.
review: see seminyak dry beautiful unfortunately last trip wet season sad see much rubbish yes great sunset sanur jimbaran without rubbish wouldnt take kid wet season much rubbish something need do improve many trader loose business people dont want

Content: We were told recent storms was the cause of the rubbish all overthe beach. Pretty sad for local business owners as it definitely turned tourists off  being at the beach. Local workers  constantly cleaning the beach but was hard for them to keep up with the  rubbish  rolling in
review: told recent storm cause rubbish overthe pretty sad local business owner definitely turn tourist local worker constantly clean hard keep rubbish roll

Content: You will find lots of upscale bars and restaurants. Take a taxi at night, as there are stray dogs that become quite aggressive in the later hours. Taxis are cheap and worth avoiding the hassle. People are friendly and nice here.
review: will find lots upscale bar restaurant take taxi night stray dog become quite aggressive later hour taxis cheap worth avoid hassle people friendly nice

Content: So sad about the beach, full of rubbish. Sharing images only because it's such a beautiful place and needs some attention. We had a great time in Bali and Gilli T. Did not spend much time on Seminyak beach for this reason, such a great place to visit still. Hope this was due to bad weather but either way more plastic free alternatives need to be in place for hotels and restaurants to keep this rubbish free, help the environment and tourism economy flowing.
review: sad full rubbish share image beautiful place need attention great time bali gilli t spend much time seminyak reason great place visit still hope due bad weather either way plastic free alternative need place hotel restaurant keep rubbish free help environment tourism economy flow

Content: The beach in Seminjak has collapsed into Inge of the worst place in the world.  In front of Hotel Puri Saron they Place Küssens in the sand beginning 3pm until midnight for a drink to watch the sunset. The mushers now reach the waterlevel. Every few meters there is terribly loud Musik from speakers, each Musik different!! I have been coming to Bali may, many time-I loved the island, but now this is a nightmare. Only money,money,money counts!Bye,bye Bali- me no more!!!
review: seminjak collapse inge bad place world front hotel puri saron place küssens sand begin 3pm midnight drink watch sunset musher now reach waterlevel every meter terribly loud musik speaker musik different come bali may many timei loved island now nightmare moneymoneymoney countsbyebye bali

Content: Lovely beach, although expect to see a lot litter which unfortunately washes up from other islands 🌴
review: lovely although expect see lot litter unfortunately wash island

Content: We came in January, and I read that there was a lot of trash on the west coast of Bali at this time, but I thought people were being dramatic. They weren't kidding. It might have been one of the dirtiest beaches I have ever been to. And it is a black sad beach (along with most of the west coast). When I heard this, I was thinking it would be like the Hawaiian black sand beaches, and I was excited. It was nothing like that. It just looked dirty. It is still soft sand though. The waves are great for surfing all year round though!
review: come january read lot trash west coast bali time think people dramatic werent kidding might one dirtiest beach black sad along west coast heard think hawaiian black sand beach excite nothing look dirty still soft sand though wave great surfing year round though

Content: This beach is out the back of the hotel we are staying in, and I must say the sunsets are superb but the beach itself is nothing to write home about lots of rubbish and people,in the evening they set up bean bags on the beach so you can chill out and watch the sunset with the obligatory drink if your into that stuff?
review: back hotel stay must say sunset superb nothing write home lot rubbish peoplein even set bean bag chill watch sunset obligatory drink stuff

Content: very dirty from the blown in rubbish. wouldn't not recommend as a relaxing beach to hang out at. very different from Australia's clean beaches
review: dirty blown rubbish wouldnt recommend relax hang different australia clean beach

Content: Dirty beachGuys get the authorities to start the cleaning process Ugly dorky beach ! Not for sun loungers Many restaurants and each clubs located on it
review: dirty beachguys authority start clean process ugly dorky sun lounger many restaurant club locate

Content: Waste waste waste. One of  the most disgusting place i've ever seen. Sorry to lost part of my holiday in this place ( we fortunately escape to Nusa Dua )
review: waste waste waste one disgusting place ive see sorry lose part holiday place fortunately escape nusa dua

Content: Grt area. Went there too take photos of sunset. Beach abit dirty.  Lots of ppl.  Bit dark walking area there. Lots of scooters.  Amazing restaurants
review: grt area go take photo sunset abit dirty lot ppl bit dark walk area lot scooter amaze restaurant

Content: Lots of rubbish and debris, too many sellers. quite a few restaurants along the beach and quite reasonable. two sunloungers were 200,000
review: lot rubbish debris many seller quite restaurant along quite reasonable two sunloungers 200000

Content: Super dirty with rubbish everywhere from used needles, plastic to you name it. The sand is black and the waves are just crashing into shore with more rubbish. Full of Aussie bogans drinking and sun baking on the dirtiest beach I have seen. Just purely tourist girly bars and cheap tourist trapped shops.Not worth visiting. There's other better beaches in Bali.
review: super dirty rubbish everywhere use needle plastic name sand black wave crash shore rubbish full aussie bogans drink sun bake dirty see purely tourist girly bar cheap tourist trap shopsnot worth visit there well beach bali

Content: We went in New Year's Day so they were prob suffering from the night before. But it looked like a rubbish dump and I couldn't see anyone trying to clean it. The sand was brown and a bit grainy. I wouldn't go back unless I was on a surf trip.
review: go new year day prob suffer night look rubbish dump couldnt see anyone try clean sand brown bit grainy wouldnt go back unless surf trip

Content: I'm glad I didn't choose a hotel by this beach as it was horrendous. It was like a rubbish dump with piles of trash which had yet to be cleared and more rubbish being washed up.I was told by a local that at this time of year, the winds and the tides bring in all the rubbish. Better beaches to be found at Nusa Dua during this period of the year.I assume the higher ratings were when reviewers were visiting during other months.Definitely do not recommend visiting this 'beach' now.
review: im glad didnt choose hotel horrendous rubbish dump pile trash yet clear rubbish wash upi tell local time year wind tide bring rubbish good beach find nusa dua period yeari assume high rating reviewer visit monthsdefinitely recommend visit now

Content: When u see a sunset in this place u realise that best things in life do come free!!!Gorgeous place. Not crowded ! U shud try and be there around sunset and see god paint the sky!
review: u see sunset place u realise best thing life come freegorgeous place crowd u shud try around sunset see god paint sky

Content: The beach is wide and the waves are good fun. Unfortunately the beach is very dirty. The locals and the hotels do their very Best to keep it clean but still there is plastic floating around in the water and is washed up on shore.The prices for sunbeds are way to high and the dealers are somewhat arrogant.I wouldn't go here again.
review: wide wave good fun unfortunately dirty local hotel best keep clean still plastic float around water wash shorethe price sunbeds way high dealer somewhat arroganti wouldnt go

Content: Seminyak's beaches close to the hotels are extremely dirty and thus I was very disappointed. I don't believe it's worth paying extra to be close to the beach.
review: seminyaks beach close hotel extremely dirty thus disappointed dont believe worth pay extra close

Content: In december because of all the storms there is rubbish all over the beach and the water is brown. In june and july the water was clear and no rubbish on the beach. I would recommend going to Seminyak just not the main beach, there are many small beaches to go too that would replace the main one.
review: december storm rubbish water brown june july water clear rubbish recommend go seminyak main many small beach go replace main one

Content: If this is the beach by potato head then it resembles a land fill site, rubbish strewn everywhere, broken furniture etc.Simply the worst beach in an area promoting tourism that I have ever been to.
review: potato head resembles land fill site rubbish strewn everywhere broken furniture etcsimply bad area promote tourism

Content: Water is kinda black. You have massage therapist annoying u with their offers. Shacks r expensive for God known reasons. You get serious sunburns in this beach even when sun was not so shinyBetter book a villa and relax there.
review: water kinda black massage therapist annoy u offer shack expensive god know reason serious sunburn even sun shinybetter book villa relax

Content: We walked down to Seminyak beach through dirty streets, loose dogs and motor bikes driving on the pavements! When we arrived at the beach all we could see was a carpet of rubbish! Nobody attempting to clear it up. It's just everywhere and it stinks. Sanitary items, needles and general crap. As we walked further along the beach it got worse. We have been to many beaches in many different countries,  this is by far the worst. Paradise LOST.
review: walk seminyak dirty street loose dog motor bike drive pavement arrive see carpet rubbish nobody attempt clear everywhere stink sanitary item needle general crap walk along get bad many beach many different country far bad paradise lose

Content: this beach is a nice place but would be better if it was cleaned more often. there is a lot of trash that washed up on shore, especially after a storm.
review: nice place well clean often lot trash wash shore especially storm

Content: You have to go to the beach when your in Seminyak but don't expect much.The sand is average, the waves are average and the beach itself is very dirty. It is crowded with chairs, bean bags, noise from bars right on the beach. You have to go and have a look but there are better things to do and don't build a whole day around it.
review: go seminyak dont expect muchthe sand average wave average dirty crowd chair bean bag noise bar right go look well thing dont build whole day around

Content: Beaches of Cuta and Seminyak are totally unswimmable due to the filth and debris in the water. Disgusting objects are everywhere and this area should be avoided. The beach vendors are a huge bother and the constant harrasment drives one up the wall - some even become aggressive if you ignore them! All in all, Bali was a complete dissapointment and the traffic is unbearble.
review: beach cuta seminyak totally unswimmable due filth debris water disgust object everywhere area avoid vendor huge bother constant harrasment drive one wall even become aggressive ignore bali complete dissapointment traffic unbearble

Content: We entered the beach at KuDeTa. It looked like this point was where beach rubbish was collected. It was great to see a rubbish removal system in place and dedicated workers collecting and removing rubbish and I am very aware that the rubbish they were collecting was doe to tourism and possibly bad weather so I am certainly not apportioning any blame however I would not go swimming as the water was visibly dirty and the sand was dirty as well. I am sorry Bali that our love of the island is the very thing causing the island to lose its feel of Paradise.
review: enter kudeta look point rubbish collect great see rubbish removal system place dedicated worker collect remove rubbish aware rubbish collecting doe tourism possibly bad weather certainly apportion blame go swimming water visibly dirty sand dirty well sorry bali love island thing cause island lose feel paradise

Content: Not sure whether due to a rare weather condition or not but the beach is very windy all day! The sand gets all over our face and eyes! Lucky my 3yo and I wear our sunnies so it helps us to see a bit clear.  We made sand castle but the beach is so dirty that we only spent 15-20mins there. There is no shower facility to clean up too. Not sure why this beach is popular but I guess not for little ones. Or maybe I chose the wrong area of the beach. Won't be coming back.
review: sure whether due rare weather condition windy day sand get face eye lucky 3yo wear sunnies help u see bit clear make sand castle dirty spent 1520mins shower facility clean sure popular guess little one maybe choose wrong area wont come back

Content: Trash everywhere! From far it looked so beautiful until getting closer where you literally see trash EVERYWHERE!!!
review: trash everywhere far looked beautiful get closer literally see trash everywhere

Content: Per the title, the beach was covered in winblown rubbish and driftwood. Nothing redeeming. Suggest going to one of the beach side clubs instead
review: per title cover winblown rubbish driftwood nothing redeem suggest go one side club instead

Content: Went to Seminyak and stayed at the RoyaB Beach for a week. The beach was a disgrace covered in filth and apart from a couple of hotels trying but losing, there was no pick up of the piles of stinking garbage mounting up on the beach.  I have never seen a beach that was so trashed and no one seemed to care.
review: go seminyak stay royab week disgrace cover filth apart couple hotel try lose pick pile stink garbage mount never see trash one seem care

Content: we went down to the beach area restaurants to meet up with friends for dinner and there are loads of eating areas with great food.took a beachfront walk to friends hotel and the beach is probably the most littered beach i have ever walked along. you could not help but not to walk on plastic drink containers. worst beach around i cannot see how the people could be proud of this area absolutely a disgrace.
review: go area restaurant meet friend dinner load eat area great foodtook beachfront walk friend hotel probably litter walk along help walk plastic drink container worst around see people proud area absolutely disgrace

Content: Arrived In Seminyak hoping to visit the beach area. Noticed large amounts of rubbish spread everywhere. Not appealing at all. Once of the dirties beaches I have come across. The locals make an effort to clean it up but it's really bad!
review: arrive seminyak hop visit area notice large amount rubbish spread everywhere appeal dirties beach come across local make effort clean really bad

Content: It was a huge disappointment to see this beach lined by plastics and garbage all along the shoreline.A complete eye sore!
review: huge disappointment see line plastic garbage along shorelinea complete eye sore

Content: Stayed in Seminyak for 7 nights and loved the restaurants on offer - all cuisines. Walked the beach every day and enjoyed the early morning tranquility. Had a sunset evening at Potato Head by the beach and this is a must do.
review: stay seminyak 7 night love restaurant offer cuisine walk every day enjoy early morning tranquility sunset even potato head must

Content: The beach was really clean even with the past storms that had happened.  They had cleaned it up nicely!  The sand was nice between my toes and the Beach was really happening.  There are a lot of lovely restaurants around this area and an easy walk from my hotel.
review: really clean even past storm happen clean nicely sand nice toe really happen lot lovely restaurant around area easy walk hotel

Content: This was the beach closest to us. It's pretty crowded. I can see why some people would call it dirty with all the tourists around. I'm sure Bali can offer you better beaches. Not really a must see.
review: close u pretty crowd see people call dirty tourist around im sure bali offer well beach really must see

Content: We were shocked at the amount of plastic and rubbish that is washed up on the beach in front of our accomodation in Seminyak. It looked like a land fill tip site. Every day teams of locals trawl through the rubbish sorting organic waste from plastic, chopping up driftwood the size of tree trunks with chainsaws and bagging up rubbish in plastic bin liners, piling it up on the sand dunes, only for it to be washed back into the ocean at high tide. I can't believe the hotels along the beach don't help with the rubbish removal.  Time for big business to make a stand and say NO to plastic and commit to cleaning up this beach for the sake of the locals who rely on tourism for their livelihood. I won't be coming back to Seminyak.
review: shocked amount plastic rubbish wash front accomodation seminyak look land fill tip site every day team local trawl rubbish sorting organic waste plastic chop driftwood size tree trunk chainsaws bag rubbish plastic bin liner pile sand dune wash back ocean high tide cant believe hotel along dont help rubbish removal time big business make stand say plastic commit clean sake local rely tourism livelihood wont come back seminyak

Content: Seminyak beach is lovely at sunset however any other time of the day it is quite busy and basically just another beach in Bali. It is pretty dirty and quite busy with tourists.
review: seminyak lovely sunset time day quite busy basically another bali pretty dirty quite busy tourist

Content: Went here as soon as I arrived in Seminyak and it's probably one of the most dirtiest beaches I've ever seen in my life. I had a surfing lesson and the waves were good, but every now and then you get caught in rubbish. Most of it comes from the sea, apparently mostly from Java (at least, that's what our surfing instructors told us). It's good to see the local people making an effort to clean it up though. The sunset is quite pretty as well if you try and overlook the rubbish along the shore.
review: go soon arrive seminyak probably one dirty beach ive see life surf lesson wave good every now catch rubbish come sea apparently mostly java least thats surf instructor tell u good see local people make effort clean though sunset quite pretty well try overlook rubbish along shore

Content: Not sure if it is the time of the year but it was full of rubbish, plastic bottles and not appealing at all..... Preferably head to nusa dua for the white sand clean beaches.
review: sure time year full rubbish plastic bottle appeal preferably head nusa dua white sand clean beach

Content: The beach is terrible there is rubbish all over it, Stay by your pool much better idea and you don't have to put up with the touts.
review: terrible rubbish stay pool much good idea dont put tout

Content: Dirty and full of rubbish. Do not swim as storm water and sewage would be of concern. Very quiet when we were there as l guess people didn't want to risk it. Lots of lounge seats to hire with water buckets at the end to clean your feet. Massages also offered.
review: dirty full rubbish swim storm water sewage concern quiet l guess people didnt want risk lot lounge seat hire water bucket end clean foot massage offer

Content: What a disgrace. We should all feel guilty as we are all responsible for it. Rubbish as far as the eye can see. Mostly plastics and mostly food-related, eg. straws, yoghurt pouches, bags. It is unfathomable how businesses like Potato Head and Ku De Ta survive surrounded by such filth. If I had booked a holiday at a beachside resort in the expectation that I'd be lying on the beach and swimming in the sea every day, I'd be devastated. This poor planet of ours is slowly choking to death and Seminyak Beach is evidence of that...
review: disgrace feel guilty responsible rubbish far eye see mostly plastic mostly foodrelated eg straws yoghurt pouch bag unfathomable business potato head ku de ta survive surround filth book holiday beachside resort expectation id lie swim sea every day id devastate poor planet slowly choke death seminyak evidence

Content: Full of rubbish. No fun for little children looking to play in the sand. Do not suggest going there unless you've heard about a massive clean up.  Jimbaran and other beaches are probably better.
review: full rubbish fun little child look play sand suggest go unless youve heard massive clean jimbaran beach probably well

Content: I have never seen the beach so dirty, kudos to the Balinese for trying to keep it clean but the water is loaded with plastic, paper and wood. Sad
review: never see dirty kudos balinese try keep clean water load plastic paper wood sad

Content: It's quite upsetting that the beach was filled with trash. EVEN WHEN YOU'RE SWIMMING IN THE SEA! They're literally everywhere. The only upside there was the ambience, & my pizza was good. It gets crowded but you can still find a private spot.
review: quite upset fill trash even youre swim sea theyre literally everywhere upside ambience pizza good get crowd still find private spot

Content: I went there to catch the sunset & it was awesome. The waves were huge and strong. It was incredibly windy.
review: go catch sunset awesome wave huge strong incredibly windy

Content: I don't know if it was the time of the year or if it is always like this nowadays, but the astonishing quantities of dirt and rubbish, piling up in mountains in the beach is totally disappointing to say the least. Seminyak is the first spot we hit on Bali once we arrived to our honeymoon. It is so sad to see the ocean and the waves carrying such amazing quantities of rubbish. We took a taxi and went to sanur, were it was much better...
review: dont know time year always nowadays astonish quantity dirt rubbish piling mountain totally disappointing say least seminyak first spot hit bali arrive honeymoon sad see ocean wave carry amazing quantity rubbish take taxi go sanur much good

Content: The view at the beach is really great, no hindrance and no mess. You can enjoy a full day out at this place and can soak in the calmness of colorful sunset.

Content: Compare it to Kuta beach, I noticed that Kuta beach is much cleaner, maybe because when I went there it was windy.

Content: Seminyak beach is one of many beach to go in Bali. Many restaurant near the beach. You can enjoy afternoon and evening on Seminyak beach. Don't forget to playing kite there

Content: Owners in the area really need to do something about regular cleaning of the beach if the autorities are idle. This lovely beach us much less attracting to visitors if it is not cleaned daily.

Content: The view is extraordinary. A mountain close to the beach is always beautiful. Beach gives a beautiful view of the sunset. A calm and serene location with a lot of cafes on the edge of the beach allows us to take a good view of the sunset and enjoy the drinks
