Content: Beach is easily accessible and evenings are very pleasant. Plenty of beach shacks with live music at night. Do try parachute lamps :)
review: easily accessible evening pleasant plenty shack live music night try parachute lamp

Content: People visit Seminyak Beach for the location. The beach itself is decent, but not wow-inducing by any means. It's crowded, but not as packed as Kuta Beach. And you will still be assaulted by throngs of itinerant salespeople. A brief "makasih, tingal disini" shall suffice.The surf is quite decent (beginner/intermediary depending on the swell) but beware: the current can be treacherous (way more than in Kuta Beach).
review: people visit seminyak location decent wowinducing mean crowd packed kuta will still assault throng itinerant salespeople brief makasih tingal disini sufficethe surf quite decent beginnerintermediary depend swell beware current treacherous way kuta

Content: Stayed in Seminyak for a week with our young child. Less hectic than Kuta. Restaurants top notch. Potato Head Beach Club a must go for food and sunset drinks. Will be coming back definitely. I love thefriendly Balinese nature.
review: stay seminyak week young child less hectic kuta restaurant top notch potato head club must go food sunset drink will come back definitely love thefriendly balinese nature

Content: Nice big beach that isn't dirty and full of trash unlike Kuta beach. Can rent beach lounge chairs with umbrellas, and the kids had a great time playing in the water and sand. Worth the visit! chez gado gado restaurant right ther as a good dining option as well.
review: nice big isnt dirty full trash unlike kuta rent lounge chair umbrellas kid great time play water sand worth visit chez gado gado restaurant right ther good dining option well

Content: A stunning beach and a beautiful sunset. The bars and hotels that line it were amazing. The only problem is a lot of it was rough and closed so if you fancy a swim you need to be either strong or have a good day.
review: stun beautiful sunset bar hotel line amaze problem lot rough closed fancy swim need either strong good day

Content: It is great for a walk or to sunbathe but I had great concerns about water quality. There are a number of outlets from inland, washing all sorts of rubbish into the sea. It was not the rubbish you can see that bothered me however but what you can't see. I would strongly advise that if you did choose to swim, you not put your head under the water for obvious reasons or swim only in the hotel pools. There were a number of signs on the beach saying dangerous to swim. I was unsure if they meant danger of rips or danger from the effluent going into the sea.
review: great walk sunbathe great concern water quality number outlet inland wash sort rubbish sea rubbish see bother cant see strongly advise choose swim put head water obvious reason swim hotel pool number sign say dangerous swim unsure mean danger rip danger effluent go sea

Content: This place is great for watching sunsets. Has quite a many bars/beach side restaurants.But the beach is really dirty.
review: place great watch sunset quite many barsbeach side restaurantsbut really dirty

Content: There is garbage and filth everywhere. Also, rivers with raw sewage run right through the beach. I ran here twice or maybe 3 times, and it was just disgusting. If you run far enough to the east, you will eventually get to a nicer color sand. However, near our hotel, this was just nasty.
review: garbage filth everywhere river raw sewage run right ran twice maybe 3 time disgust run far enough east will eventually nicer color sand near hotel nasty

Content: having afternoon snack while waiting for sunset here. the view was pretty amazing. and it's not too crowd for enjoyable sunset-time.
review: afternoon snack wait sunset view pretty amaze crowd enjoyable sunsettime

Content: Seminyak beach is less crowded than Kuta, still a lot of rubbish and debris in the ocean and on the shore.Nice enough to kick back and relax with a Bintang. Many resorts back into the beach.The wet season clouds make for a beautiful sunset.
review: seminyak less crowded kuta still lot rubbish debris ocean shorenice enough kick back relax bintang many resort back beachthe wet season cloud make beautiful sunset

Content: Nice beach but they really do need to employ some locals to clean and maintain the beach. A lot of rubbish and building materials littering the beach.
review: nice really need employ local clean maintain lot rubbish building material litter

Content: Centrally located, easy accessibility pretty decent food outlets good music. Best time would be sunrise and sunset. Less crowded than kuta beach.
review: centrally locate easy accessibility pretty decent food outlet good music best time sunrise sunset less crowded kuta

Content: Lovely beach with fine sand, gentle breeze, and inspiring ocean front.  I like this beach better than Kuta beach.  It is cleaner, less commericialized, and much less crowded.  The hawkers seem gentler too so a person can walk around without too much hassle.  That said, there are ample "fine" eateries (fine dining now equals higher priced dining) with outstanding views of the beach and people in the beach.  This place is where you can have fine dining for about 10 USD in the Fall/winter of 2015
review: lovely fine sand gentle breeze inspire ocean front well kuta clean less commericialized much less crowded hawker seem gentler person walk around without much hassle say ample fine eatery fine din now equal high price din outstanding view people place fine din 10 usd fallwinter 2015

Content: Very lively. Feel like jamming and listening to nice music with humble musicians (Just Us)... Playing on the beach.  from about 6-630pm onwards
review: lively feel jam listen nice music humble musician u play 6630pm onwards

Content: The beach in front of the resort was closed most days, probably rips or dumpers. There were surf schools near the resort but niot good surf.
review: front resort close day probably rip dumper surf school near resort niot good surf

Content: The water was really warm. The locals there are really nice. However, there are a lot of trash on the beach. I really hope the local officials take notice of the trash littering and clean it up.
review: water really warm local really nice lot trash really hope local official take notice trash litter clean

Content: The scenes there are lovely.  Great to watch the sun set.  There is a ridiculous amount of trash all over the place though, especially along the water line.
review: scene lovely great watch sun set ridiculous amount trash place though especially along water line

Content: I loved this beach, the views are breathtaking. Great for surfing, you can rent lounge chairs if you're ok with spending the money. There's places to eat along the beach and watch the sun sets. The only thing I didn't like was the vendors walking around trying to sell things, they won't leave you alone so you have to be firm if you're not interesting in purchasing anything.
review: love view breathtaking great surfing rent lounge chair youre ok spending money there place eat along watch sun set thing didnt vendor walk around try sell thing wont leave alone firm youre interest purchase anything

Content: The beach is nothing special, it is walking distance from a number of hotels. the sand is not clean white sand like you see on Australian beaches, but it is pleasant enough to sit back and relax on.
review: nothing special walk distance number hotel sand clean white sand see australian beach pleasant enough sit back relax

Content: We have been to Bali a number of times in Jan/Feb and on every occasion on the Kuta - Seminyak beaches it is the same:nice beach but man what a lot of rubbish. Apparently it all washes in from the sea (plastics mainly) and the authorities (?) do not know how to handle it. Halfhearted attempts are made to clean up every now and again but nowhere near enough. I appreciate it's not an easy problem but with all that money poring in from the tourist industry I'm convinced a lot mre could be done.
review: bali number time janfeb every occasion kuta seminyak beach samenice man lot rubbish apparently wash sea plastic mainly authority know handle halfhearted attempt make clean every now nowhere near enough appreciate easy problem money pore tourist industry im convince lot mre do

Content: Sea very rough, lots of red flags up, my partner did go in swimming  but as he was walking into the sea stepped into a large hole which was quite a shock.  Nice large expanse of beach to walk on but you did tend to sink in the sand.
review: sea rough lot red flags partner go swim walk sea step large hole quite shock nice large expanse walk tend sink sand

Content: With a whole range of great restaurants, day clubs and hotels, Seminyak is a lovely area of Bali. Away from the hustle of rough tourists, it offers a surprising level of quality and professionalism. Great area to stay.
review: whole range great restaurant day club hotel seminyak lovely area bali away hustle rough tourist offer surprising level quality professionalism great area stay

Content: Even they tried to clean the beach in the morning. But not every day got lots of plastics on the beach and in the water. Locals are nice and friendly. A peaceful beach sort of.
review: even tried clean morning every day get lot plastic water local nice friendly peaceful sort

Content: We didn't surf at Seminyak beach but walked it a lot. Great for running too. Like any other beach in the area, there are a lot of dogs running around, and they do leave their business in the sand, so mind your feet. What upset me was, westerns who own dogs here also put a blind eye to it. They don't clean after their dogs.There were quite a few storms out in the sea, so there was a lot of rubbish on the beach which is understandable, and in some areas it is being cleared all the time. However, I saw many people, especially locals just leaving their rubbish on the beach after watching the sunsets, even though the bins were right behind them. A bit upsetting.
review: didnt surf seminyak walk lot great run area lot dog run around leave business sand mind foot upset western dog put blind eye dont clean dogsthere quite storms sea lot rubbish understandable area clear time saw many people especially local leave rubbish watch sunset even though bin right behind bit upsetting

Content: We went to the beach around Ku De Ta (enter from KuDeTa passage), recommended to go in the morning around 9 if you bring young kids or baby as the wave can be quite rough in the afternoon and the heat can be too much for them. You can rent beach chairs (2 chairs+1 umbrella) at IDR 100.000 for 3 hours and have sips of fresh coconuts (idr 30.000).I would say the beach is clean enough, it's not that you'd get tons of rubbish on ur foot as some reviews saying it's a dirty beach.. ;)
review: go around ku de ta enter kudeta passage recommend go morning around 9 bring young kid baby wave quite rough afternoon heat much rent chair 2 chairs1 umbrella idr 100000 3 hour sip fresh coconut idr 30000i say clean enough youd ton rubbish ur foot review say dirty

Content: You can't leave Bali without coming here! The atmosphere is so amazing, fun friendly faces, so much to see and do, restaurants, bars! Double Six Beach is the place to be!
review: cant leave bali without come atmosphere amaze fun friendly face much see restaurant bar double six place

Content: We just walked along the beach, it was very nice and pretty popular full of kids relaxing, smoking and drinking - looked like a great day to spend a Sunday Funday..
review: walk along nice pretty popular full kid relax smoke drinking look great day spend sunday funday

Content: Without doubt the dirtiest beach I've ever experienced, water was full of rubbish and the beach was littered as far as the eye can see. My recommendation is to avoid it and just go sit in one of the resorts by the pool
review: without doubt dirtiest ive experience water full rubbish litter far eye see recommendation avoid go sit one resort pool

Content: Definitely not a swimming beach so be aware that if you book hotels near you cannot swim (too many rips).  Great for a walk on the beach or sunbathing.
review: definitely swim aware book hotel near swim many rip great walk sunbathe

Content: Free public beach. You need to rent lounge chair and umbrella. We were here during the rainy season and there were quite high waves, making it difficult to swim. Not very clean with debris washing up the shore.
review: free public need rent lounge chair umbrella rainy season quite high wave make difficult swim clean debris wash shore

Content: It is a beautiful place and much cleaner than anything in Kuta. Not as many hagglers as well. Highly recommend!
review: beautiful place much clean anything kuta many haggler well highly recommend

Content: Wide and clean beach along Seminyak. It offers miles of walking and many opportunities for waves to learn surfing. If you go for a walk try to avoid the little “rivers” that flow into the see. The smell reveals that this is not fresh water.Unfortunately this is not the white dream beach with a backdrop of palm trees that you imagine when you dream of Bali.
review: wide clean along seminyak offer mile walk many opportunity wave learn surf go walk try avoid little river flow see smell reveals fresh waterunfortunately white dream backdrop palm tree imagine dream bali

Content: I went here with my fiancé to relax for the day & it was amazing.  Really clean beach with lots of food places/stalls nearby.! Highly recommend !
review: go fiancé relax day amaze really clean lot food placesstalls nearby highly recommend

Content: Astonished at the filthy beach and locals using drains to beach as a toilet. All the people lazing around you'd think some of them could pick up on the beaches and though a fares.
review: astonish filthy local use drain toilet people laze around youd think pick beach though fare

Content: Hard to beat at sunset. The most attractive of the Kuta-Legian-Seminyak strip of beaches.Although other posts have mentioned rubbish etc, it was clean when we were there (several visits, from 21-27 Jan 2016), although it rained every day. We were at the southern end - apparently the stream in the north near the temple can bring out rubbish after rain.Negotiate for umbrella lounges on the beach - we paid IDR50,000 for a 2-bed lounge, which is probably expensive, but, hey, for $5 all day, who cares? The same chap who sells you the lounge can also supply you with well-priced cold drinks (coke, beer, coconuts etc).Note for foreign tourists - you can't sit on the lounges for free 'just for 10 minutes', as we saw several tourists try to do, including a couple of female Australians who wanted to change their toddler's nappy (!). The lounges are rented, it's how those guys make their living - if they let everyone sit on the lounges 'just for 10 minutes', they wouldn't make a rupiah.There are some sellers trawling the beach, but they're not too pushy, and perhaps not as numerous as in Kuta and Legian.You can just sit on your towels on the beach for free, but you might get burnt that way.There are numerous beach shacks south of Jl. Camplung Tanduk, they are cheap and good for burgers, juices and beer.Surf is good for boogie boarding and body surfing. Gets a bit rough and erratic, with some cross-currents, at the end of low tide, be careful near the breakers at this time.If you're lucky enough to be from a place with outstanding beaches (e.g. Australia, South Africa, Hawaii, California),  you might think this beach is not much. But by world standards it is very pleasant and enjoyable. Recommended.
review: hard beat sunset attractive kutalegianseminyak strip beachesalthough post mention rubbish etc clean several visit 2127 jan 2016 although rain every day southern end apparently stream north near temple bring rubbish rainnegotiate umbrella lounge pay idr50000 2bed lounge probably expensive hey 5 day care chap sell lounge supply wellpriced cold drink coke beer coconut etcnote foreign tourist cant sit lounge free 10 minute saw several tourist try include couple female australian want change toddler nappy lounge rent guy make live let everyone sit lounge 10 minute wouldnt make rupiahthere seller trawl theyre pushy perhaps numerous kuta legianyou sit towel free might burn waythere numerous shack south jl camplung tanduk cheap good burger juice beersurf good boogie board body surf get bit rough erratic crosscurrent end low tide careful near breaker timeif youre lucky enough place outstanding beach eg australia south africa hawaii california might think much world standard pleasant enjoyable recommend

Content: The beach is pretty normal. Rather dirty sand in fact. Worth a skip unless you plan to chill at their bars. We witnessed a cremation ceremony there.  Interesting to see how people can throw the ashes and swim within such close proximity
review: pretty normal rather dirty sand fact worth skip unless plan chill bar witness cremation ceremony interest see people throw ash swim within close proximity

Content: Nothing in the beach, no rides, no shag, nothing to do, just a visit that to I'd time permits. As major hotels have their private beaches, so much crowd is expected.
review: nothing ride shag nothing visit id time permit major hotel private beach much crowd expect

Content: nice beach, best palces to go if you want a subbed day our the private resorts with access to beaches, but this was our local beach, beach clean with many surfers, toilet access and food and beverage
review: nice best palces go want sub day private resort access beach local clean many surfer toilet access food beverage

Content: all restaurant facities are fantastic, the food is great and the staff are freindly and helpful, it is the people of Bali who make the holiday experinec what it is - amazing
review: restaurant facities fantastic food great staff freindly helpful people bali make holiday experinec amaze

Content: Yes, there are a fair bit of rubbish laying around, but grab a lounge and relax with a drink.   It's just an OK beach.  There are better places to sit at a beach restaurant - Jimbaran Beach seafood restaurants for example.  Seminyak Beach has the beachside cafes tho.  In good weather it's worth the trip.
review: yes fair bit rubbish lay around grab lounge relax drink ok good place sit restaurant jimbaran seafood restaurant example seminyak beachside cafe tho good weather worth trip

Content: I have to concur with some of the others who have reviewed this beach, in particular Leylandbros who reviewed only yesterday. I walked from my hotel this afternoon looking forward to a nice walk on the beach following a lovely few days in Ubud. My initial impression was ugh, but I  proceeded to walk hoping things would get better. In the end my partner and I were so disgusted by the amount of rubbish on the sand that we had to leave, vowing never to set foot on this beach again. I was horrified by the beaches of Sihanoukville but this is the Wes Craven version of horror! :-(
review: concur others review particular leylandbros review yesterday walk hotel afternoon look forward nice walk follow lovely day ubud initial impression ugh proceeded walk hop thing well end partner disgusted amount rubbish sand leave vow never set foot horrify beach sihanoukville wes craven version horror

Content: Only go there for sunset... if you want to spend a nice beach day go somewhere else like Uluwatu... or stay in your villa's pool!
review: go sunset want spend nice day go somewhere uluwatu stay villa pool

Content: Know Seminyak beach for years, When was not busy and with famous 66 Club. Now the beach is much more touristic with plenty of good choices.One of my favorite.
review: know seminyak year busy famous 66 club now much touristic plenty good choicesone favorite

Content: Perfect end to a sun soaked day! Bintangs and sunsets...🍻 lots of beach bars to choose from, with colourful beanbags and live music to chill to.
review: perfect end sun soak day bintangs sunset lot bar choose colourful beanbag live music chill

Content: It is rare for me to be so horrified and critical but my walk down the beach on the 4th of February, 2016, was shocking. Due to heavy rain the previous day, a huge amount of rubbish and waste had been flushed out into the waters of the beach. There were signs up saying that swimming was not permitted - due to the high levels of Coliforms in the water. Several of the Hotels were attempting to clean up some of the rubbish on the section of the beach. It seemed like a losing battle. It is so sad for the people of Bali that this happens on a regular basis.
review: rare horrify critical walk 4th february 2016 shock due heavy rain previous day huge amount rubbish waste flush water sign say swimming permit due high level coliforms water several hotel attempt clean rubbish section seem losing battle sad people bali happen regular basis

Content: Have been to Seminyak several times and though still beautiful on high tide and sunset was disappointed how dirty many sections were on low tide.
review: seminyak several time though still beautiful high tide sunset disappoint dirty many section low tide

Content: The beach is filthy. Plastic bottles, cigarette buds and plastic bags every were. The lounge chairs are overpriced. The locals try to get somewhere between 50.000-200.000 IR.souvenir sellers bother you every five minutes and the restaurants and bars play loud music all day. Not much of the Balinese magic there.It's great for surfers. And I enjoyed a day in the sun on my Bintang towel in the sand. Was very happy to catch some rays after 4 days of rain and no sun.
review: filthy plastic bottle cigarette buds plastic bag every lounge chair overprice local try somewhere 50000200000 irsouvenir seller bother every five minute restaurant bar play loud music day much balinese magic thereits great surfer enjoy day sun bintang towel sand happy catch ray 4 day rain sun

Content: A nice sandy beach that's not too crowded, we reached the place at about 8, most of the crowd from sunset watching would have left. Nothing much to rave about, the seafood wasn't as cheap as acclaimed, neither was it good.The only saving grace was the corn, a man with his push cart peddling his corn with his kerosene lamp. That was the best corn I had, the ones in Kuta just didn't make the mark.Be sure to grab one when you're there!
review: nice sandy thats crowd reached place 8 crowd sunset watching leave nothing much rave seafood wasnt cheap acclaim neither goodthe save grace corn man push cart peddle corn kerosene lamp best corn one kuta didnt make markbe sure grab one youre

Content: Not my favourite beach in the world.Went on an overcast day so that didn't help sell it to me but over all this beach is fine but a bit dirty (rubbish). Plenty of medium sized surf (if that's what your into). Heaps of beachside bars with sofa beds / bean bags for you to crash out. Overall it's ok.
review: favourite worldwent overcast day didnt help sell fine bit dirty rubbish plenty medium size surf thats heap beachside bar sofa bed bean bag crash overall ok

Content: i visited the beach in Jan 16 during the raining season, it's a great beach to walk along the coast and watch the sunset, during my visit the beach was full of big waves and surfers, very clean and visiting the beach is a must.

Content: This is a nice beach with lots of sand and numerous local vendors looking to make a quick buck. You can buy beer, soda and chips. You can rent an umbrella/cabana. Numerous surfboard rentals. Or you can just walk the beach. The only off is the large amount of trash all over the beach. It is a tragedy that so much trash is polluted into the ocean and that the vendors don't help clean it up.

Content: Splendid!  Love the beach and the swells. Be sure to take time to read the waves first before jumping in.

Content: Long beach, not overcrowded. Beautiful scenery. Hot spot for all surfers and young people. Nice place!
review: long overcrowd beautiful scenery hot spot surfer young people nice place

Content: We enjoyed it but please take the effort to get rid of all the rubbish on the beach and in the water.
review: enjoyed please take effort rid rubbish water

Content: Its one of the nice and clean beach with good amount of restaurants and cafes. Easy to reach and has great sunsets. The tides are relatively low so good to swim
review: one nice clean good amount restaurant cafes easy reach great sunset tide relatively low good swim

Content: The beaches of Seminyak are simply divine! You see Nature's masterpiece everywhere you turn. Will definitely be back!

Content: The only stand-out was its sunsets. Otherwise the sand is quite dark, water was a bit rough and there was a bit of rubbish. Depends on the type of beaches you're used to experiencing, I guess.

Content: Nice to play at evening. Along the beach has many cafe, wide and long beach. A good spot for  viewing sunset

Content: This beach was ok and a bit cleaner than some but too rough most of the time for an old wimpy non surfer! Some quirky beach cafes with colorful beanbag seats and umbrellas giving the place a nice vibe!

Content: We liked this beach especially after seeing Kuta Beach which was very dirty . the beach is large so the closer you are to Legian it gets a little dirty and busy but if you are Closer to Petingenget is quite and very nice . Also you don't have a million sellers following you . there are better beaches in Bali but it was a good experience .
review: like especially see kuta dirty large close legian get little dirty busy close petingenget quite nice dont million seller follow well beach bali good experience

Content: Good restaurants/ bars along the beach, great for sunset.  Like most southern beaches in Bali more rubbish than you would expect, and at night they open water from the city into the sea, from the smell as it goes in I will never swim here again!  Further north a little cleaner I think, but still got sick after swallowing too much water failing at learning to surf.  Slightly less crowded than Kuta, more than Berawa.
review: good restaurant bar along great sunset southern beach bali rubbish expect night open water city sea smell go will never swim north little cleaner think still get sick swallow much water fail learn surf slightly less crowded kuta berawa

Content: Seminyak doesn't have the nicest beaches. Nusa Dua (although a fair distance away) is where i would recommend if you'd like to go swimming in crystal clear blue water and bake on golden sand. Seminyak beach has choppy waves (similar to the gold coast) and is overall not as pleasant.
review: seminyak doesnt nice beach nusa dua although fair distance away recommend youd go swimming crystal clear blue water bake golden sand seminyak choppy wave similar gold coast overall pleasant

Content: This was the beach where my partner proposed to me (in a quieter area with no hagglers) was beautiful! Almost no rubbish compared to Kuta which was covered in rubbish. We hired beach chairs for 50,000 IDR (around $5 AUS) for 2 hours and beers were around $2.50 each for a Bintang aswell so made the day nice and relaxing. Prepare to get hassled by people selling stuff but just say no or ignore them and continue relaxing.
review: partner propose quiet area haggler beautiful almost rubbish compare kuta cover rubbish hire chair 50000 idr around 5 aus 2 hour beer around 250 bintang aswell make day nice relax prepare hassled people sell stuff say ignore continue relax

review: great visit rainy season kuta legion beach full rubbish weather seem lot less seminyak restaurant bean bag setting afternoon cool

Content: Seminyak is a great place for surfing, chill out at the bars with live music performance. Plenty of bars around there. You can buy a drink at the restaurant and get a shaded umbrella instead of renting sun bed. Surfing board can be rented at rp 40000 an hour. Instructor will cost rp 50000 an hour.
review: seminyak great place surf chill bar live music performance plenty bar around buy drink restaurant shade umbrella instead rent sun bed surf board rent rp 40000 hour instructor will cost rp 50000 hour

Content: I went here just want to see the famous Seminyak Beach. I came before noon, unfortunately there were not so many people there. I think it must be crowded in the afternoon when peoples want to see the sunset at the beach. Around the beach you can find luxury hotels and restaurants.
review: go want see famous seminyak come noon unfortunately many people think must crowd afternoon people want see sunset around find luxury hotel restaurant

Content: After being to all the beautiful beaches between Nusa dua and Uluwatu, this was a real let down. Went for a walk along here, was abysmal. Really dull looking beach littered with rubbish.

Content: Seminyak is the best place I love to visit. Not too crowded but enjoyable life here. Beautiful beach with some good atmosphere of beach clubs like potato head, kudeta, Woobar to spend time waiting sunset

Content: The Seminyak beach is a really nice beach. But with all the people there, it's hard to really enjoy the calm or the ocean. There is also several people trying to sell stuff all the way and everywhere. Not the kind of beach to relax. Good place to enjoy a drink or beer. In february, the ocean is hard to swim at this place.
review: seminyak really nice people hard really enjoy calm ocean several people try sell stuff way everywhere kind relax good place enjoy drink beer february ocean hard swim place

Content: We went on 5 different beaches in Bali, but liked this one. Water is very clean also the beach is kept clean. It is not crowded and you can enjoy the sun in peace. Ignore all the sellers by just saying "thank you" and they will not disturb you more. Nearby is a lot fof restaurants and coffee shops, also taxis.
review: go 5 different beach bali like one water clean keep clean crowd enjoy sun peace ignore seller say thank will disturb nearby lot fof restaurant coffee shop taxis

Content: There is no real direction to the beach in seminyak. One end is carpark and the other is through the hotels and resorts. There is no board walk as such. If your staying in one of the hotels on the beach that would be fine.
review: real direction seminyak one end carpark hotel resort board walk stay one hotel fine

Content: Walked five minutes down the road from our hotel to Seminyak beach and what a disappointment!! Black sand, stray dogs sleeping under chairs, rubbish and hawkers selling their wares. Only upside was the water was warm. Preferred to stay at our hotels man made beach
review: walk five minute road hotel seminyak disappointment black sand stray dog sleep chair rubbish hawker sell ware upside water warm prefer stay hotel man make

Content: We walked from Kuta to Seminyak via Legian, it was quite long walk but worth it! Very crowded places but the sceneries were unique and beautiful! Night walk on the beach was very pleasant with lights from resorts and sounds of wave although it was rainy.
review: walk kuta seminyak via legian quite long walk worth crowd place scenery unique beautiful night walk pleasant light resort sound wave although rainy

Content: We arrived here walking up the path at sunset. Having come from ubud it was surreal dripping into the beach party that was going on but we didn't hesitate! Drinks and apps at la plancha were great. Fun friendly people to talk to not. Next morning came down again and walked about a mile checking out the waves. The water is so warm it's like a bathtub. There are several surf schools including a Riptide school that looked fun. Cost approx $60-$85usd. Disappointing amount of litter washed up along the beach. The restaurants nearer us like la plancha clear it away. I think the restaurants and resorts should all pitch in the clean up the beach. Good for business and for the environment. Hawkers were there but pleasant and didn't keep pushing after you say no unlike what we experienced in ubud.
